procedure.title: Application for naturalization by decree
procedure.page.title: Application for naturalization by decree
procedure.step.title: 5 steps for your application

identity.step.long: Verify your civil status and personal information and those of your ancestors and relatives

procedure.preparationText:
To complete your application, you must be in possession :

  • acts of civil status of your parents
  • Only if you do not want to allow the administration of foreigners to retrieve that data directly from the URSSAF : supporting resource (contract(s) of work, previous employment certificates, attastation employment center as appropriate, last three newsletters salary, wages bulettins November and December the last three years),
  • Only if you do not want to allow the administration of foreigners to retrieve that data directly from the Public Finance : a slip P237 recent tax position on the imposition of the past three years and the tax notice of 3 recent years.

All supporting documents must be accompanied, where appropriate, a translation into French by a certified translator interpreter near an appellate court.

Find a certified translator interpreter

form.subtitle: You are about to make an application for naturalization by decree. Before paying, make sure that the information below are correct.
form.identity: My personal information and those of my close

form.informations: Your stamp duty amounts to 55.00 euros. It will be charged regardless of the outcome of your request.

The admissibility of your application will be verified by the Administration of foreigners in France.
If your application is admissible, you will receive a confirmation notice telling you to make an appointment for an interview assimilation.
If your application is inadmissible, we will tell you and you will specify the reason(s) element(s) missing(s) where applicable.

After the appointment, your case will be heard and you will be notified of the decision.
If the decision is favorable, you will be prompted to a welcoming ceremony in the French nationality in which you will be given the naturalization decree.
If the decision is unfavorable, you will informed of the remedies you have.
